70c7129b-4008-4d90-b19d-42b9365c440c.description: Earners of the Client-Centered Integrative Approach to Health badge are equipped with the necessary tools to provide interprofessional patient-centered care, which is proven to improve patient satisfaction, reduce overall cost of care and improve the health of the general population. They are able to apply integrative health and interprofessional skills in realistic situations involving a client and a team of health professionals.
70c7129b-4008-4d90-b19d-42b9365c440c.name: Client-Centered Integrative Approach to Health

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the National Center for Integrative Primary Healthcare’s (NCIPH) “Foundations in Integrative Health” online curriculum. Demonstrated improvement in the NCIPH's “Foundations in Integrative Health—Knowledge Examination” which measures relevant medical knowledge retention after curriculum completion and the NCIPH “Foundations in Integrative Health – Self-Assessment,” which measures attitudes towards integrative health.

Participants produced a comprehensive case study offering multiple perspectives on interprofessional teams with 7-8 other health professional students (Physician Assistant, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Nursing).

Recipients identified integrative health opportunities to enhance client wellness based in the three categories of social determinants of health: physical environment, social environment and individual characteristics/behaviors

d45a6109-f9df-46e9-a7f8-765529c8b45b.description: Earners of the Interprofessioanl Health Literacy Education and Practice badge demonstrate an understanding of health literacy best practices for client interactions. They have the ability to assess client health literacy levels and adjust communication and materials accordingly. Additionally, these earners are able to incorporate their knowledge of health literacy practices when working on an interprofessional team.
d45a6109-f9df-46e9-a7f8-765529c8b45b.name: Interprofessional Health Literacy Education and Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have demonstrated health literacy competencies in final poster and presentation for interprofessional faculty reviewers, and developed or revised patient education materials to meet the client’s health literacy level.

Recipients have demonstrated interprofessional practice team improvement in an original health literacy evaluation tool developed specifically to measure the learning outcomes of the health literacy education.

bc7713ce-1a59-443a-a2b5-2f6cfff14547.description: Earners will administer screening for mental health disorders and recognize mental health challenges in the Waukesha Free Clinic at Carroll University. Earners will create and implement strategies to improve their clients' mental health.
bc7713ce-1a59-443a-a2b5-2f6cfff14547.name: Meeting Mental Health Needs of the Underserved

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will demonstrate their mental health literacy competency and empathetic mental health care approach by working in the Waukesha Free Clinic at Carroll University with clinic patients. They will be evaluated by faculty preceptors.
At the conclusion of their experiences working in the Waukesha Free Clinic, students will complete poster presentations demonstrating what they have learned through their interprofessional teams.

4d7eebb8-e132-452e-ad30-cb010fea6fa6.description: The peer-reviewed Mental Health First Aid program that helps improve the student's skills in recognizing signs and symptoms of mental and substance use disorders as well as identify and reduce stigma surrounding mental health and substance use disorders.
4d7eebb8-e132-452e-ad30-cb010fea6fa6.name: Mental Health First Aid

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients will successfully complete the six hour course, Mental Health First Aid, consisting of a two-hour online module and four-hour instructor led training.
Earners will demonstrate their knowledge through application of their action-plan with simulated patients.

5aa134c8-d00d-45a6-8f7c-02a5c021a768.description: Earners will learn how to provide empathic and effective care in interprofessional teams for patients with mental health and/or substance use disorders as well as act on decreasing the stigma surrounding such conditions. Earners will gain real-time experience working in the free clinic with the guidance of healthcare professionals. At the end of the three badge sequence, students will be evaluated on their performance in a health care clinic.
5aa134c8-d00d-45a6-8f7c-02a5c021a768.name: Mental Health Literacy with Healthcare Students

badge_template_activities.title: Mental Health First Aid
Meeting Mental Health Needs of the Underserved
Proficiency in Interprofessional Approach to Mental Health Care

70fe1731-e4ca-41ac-852b-05bc4622cad7.description: Earners will learn to recognize signs and symptoms of mental health issues and concerns through empathy and effective collaboration with an interprofessional team. Earners are able to differentiate between emergent and non-emergent situations, and collaborate as a team to give appropriate interventions, while assessing for risk of suicide or harm. Earners of this badge demonstrate an ability to provide quality and empathetic care while working with those in their community.
70fe1731-e4ca-41ac-852b-05bc4622cad7.name: Proficiency in Interprofessional Approach to Mental Health Care

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge will participate in a simulation interview. At appropriate times, the team member will consult virtually for suggested interventions appropriate to the scenario.
The earner has participated in the after-simulation debriefing to review the interview and actions recommended by consultants.

64b2da74-e727-497f-8cb6-a97dc6edaf02.description: Recipients of this badge have demonstrated an ability to: Provide patient-centered care as part of an interprofessional team, develop and implement integrative health interventions with patients, and utilize health literacy best practices in client interactions.
64b2da74-e727-497f-8cb6-a97dc6edaf02.name: Community-Based Integrative Health Interprofessional Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Client-Centered Integrative Approach to Health
Interprofessional Practice in a Medically Underserved Community
Interprofessional Health Literacy Education and Practice

7e516929-7638-4062-bb2a-0fe258cf8ebd.description: Earners of the Interprofessional Practice in a Medically Underserved Community badge are capable of delivering integrative health in a medically-underserved community to enhance the health of a client. They demonstrate knowledge of and the ability to apply the core competencies of interprofessional collaborative practice.
7e516929-7638-4062-bb2a-0fe258cf8ebd.name: Interprofessional Practice in a Medically Underserved Community

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have demonstrated improvement in Readiness for Interprofessional Learning Scale (RIPLS) which measures teamwork/collaboration, negative/positive professional identity, and roles/responsibilities and/or in Interprofessional Collaborative Competencies Attainment Scale (ICCAS) which measures communication, collaboration, roles/responsibilities, patient-centered approach, conflict management and team functioning before/after the IPP experience.

Recipients have completed, submitted, and presented an interprofessional poster presentation written by interprofessional teams reporting findings from the implementation of their opportunity to enhance wellness intervention with their community-dwelling senior client. Recipients have demonstrated IPP competencies in final poster and presentation for interprofessional faculty reviewers.

d728de43-6ac9-417c-ac2f-c8dc49ec4257.description: This microcredential examines current research on cognition, reading disorders, and research-based implications for instruction. Knowledge on the construct of dyslexia, including key terms, definitions, and laws is emphasized.
d728de43-6ac9-417c-ac2f-c8dc49ec4257.name: Foundations of Reading and Dyslexia

alignments.name: IDA
alignments.description: This badge aligns to IDA Standard 1: Foundations of Literacy Acquisition and IDA Standard 2: Knowledge of Diverse Reading Profiles, Including Dyslexia.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the series of MindPlay modules and submitted evidence to their instructors.
Earners of this badge have completed all workbook activities from Multisensory Teaching.
Earners of this badge have completed dyslexia knowledge modules on Canvas and submitted evidence.

632ef44e-0738-4cdb-bc85-7af01876e5b5.description: Earners of the Advanced Word Reading Instruction badge develop knowledge of literacy acquisition. They demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of orthographic mapping processes and are capable of explaining the relationships among phonological awareness, phonic decoding, spelling, accurate and automatic word recognition, fluency, background knowledge, vocabulary, reading comprehension, and writing.
632ef44e-0738-4cdb-bc85-7af01876e5b5.name: Advanced Word Reading Instruction

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass three modules: 1) Orthographic mapping; 2) Phonemes and Phonemic Awareness; 3) Word Level Reading

35f54e8a-571c-4c51-b5bb-ea080c46caf7.description: Participants who earn this badge demonstrate an understanding of best practices for client interactions including but not limited to motivational interviewing, communication, conflict resolution, and development of materials that reflect client health literacy levels. Additionally, these earners are able to incorporate their knowledge and assessment of health literacy practices when working on an interprofessional team.
35f54e8a-571c-4c51-b5bb-ea080c46caf7.name: Interprofessional Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the Interprofessional Collaborative Competency Attainment Survey (ICCAS) with noted improvement scores.
Produced a comprehensive case study, presentation, and/or poster offering multiple perspectives on interprofessional teams with other health professional students (PA, PT, OT, and Nursing)

Identified and applied integrative health opportunities to enhance client wellness based in at least one of the three categories of social determinants of health: physical environment, social environment and individual characteristics/behaviors

667c95e8-4f86-44b3-9075-0064f88a687f.description: Participants who receive this badge are equipped with the necessary tools to provide Interprofessional patient-centered care that endorses diverse professional collaboration to optimize health and wellness of a client and/or a population within and outside various health systems.
667c95e8-4f86-44b3-9075-0064f88a687f.name: Interprofessional Core Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the CAIPER on-line curriculum "Core Interprofessional" and "Interprofessional Primary Care" modules.
Successfully completed the Interprofessional Knowledge Questionnaire.

449afdf8-47a8-44bb-8d42-85eb4c3da181.description: Participants who earn this badge have demonstrated the ability to engage with other health professionals to create problem focused problem solving to increase the effectiveness of team-based services and programs.
449afdf8-47a8-44bb-8d42-85eb4c3da181.name: Interprofessional Teamwork

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the Interprofessional Collaborative Competency Attainment Survey (ICCAS) with noted improvement scores.
Produced a comprehensive case study, presentation, and/or poster offering multiple perspectives on interprofessional teams with other health professional students
Collaborate and submit a Team charter which outlines team-based roles and responsibilities

5ecebca1-1da9-4870-a5db-b96f8320ce95.description: Equipped with the necessary tools to provide interprofessional patient-centered care that maintains a climate of mutual respect and shared values. They are able to deliver interprofessional population health programs and services that promote health equity across the lifespan to a culturally diverse community population while upholding high ethical standards of practice.
5ecebca1-1da9-4870-a5db-b96f8320ce95.name: Interprofessional Values and Ethics

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the Interprofessional Collaborative Competency Attainment Survey (ICCAS) with noted improvement scores.

Identified and applied integrative health opportunities to enhance client wellness based in at least one of the three categories of social determinants of health: physical environment, social environment and individual characteristics/behaviors.

Produced a comprehensive case study, presentation, and/or poster offering multiple perspectives on Interprofessional teams with other health professional students (Physician Assistant, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Nursing)

e8f4b3f3-0b99-4fb9-bc11-7b74a7158d59.description: Earners of the Assessment of Reading with Practicum badge have learned to create a comprehensive reading intervention that focuses on both word recognition and comprehension. Earners have demonstrated an application of effective assessment tools and instruction through a 12-week practicum, working one-on-one with a student.
e8f4b3f3-0b99-4fb9-bc11-7b74a7158d59.name: Assessment of Reading Practicum

alignments.name: IDA Standard 3: Assessment
alignments.description: Demonstrate knowledge and skill with multiple measures of literacy assessment for diagnostic and instructional purposes.

alignments.name: IDA Standard 4: Structured Literacy Instruction
alignments.description: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of literacy acquisition and provide effective instruction for learners with dyslexia.

alignments.name: IDA Standard 5: Professional Dispositions and Practices
alignments.description: Demonstrate skills and disposition for effectively working with learners with reading difficulty.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed a 12-week practicum entailing 24 one-hour sessions with a reader with characteristics of dyslexia. Earners were observed three times by a qualified Dyslexia Interventionist practicum supervisor and provided feedback on their instruction.

Earners learned and applied methods of assessment for students with characteristics of dyslexia. Earners analyzed pre and post assessment data and used these data to guide structured literacy lesson planning and reflect on responsiveness to instruction.

2451df4f-8ac4-4bd0-8705-c4223f6f9f5d.description: Demonstrated advanced understanding and application of IPE principles. Delivered and provided health and/or wellness programs and/or materials to a member/s of a population with consideration for health literacy, culture, health disparities, and health equality.
2451df4f-8ac4-4bd0-8705-c4223f6f9f5d.name: Health Interprofessional Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the Interprofessional Collaborative Competency Attainment Survey (ICCAS) with noted improvement scores.

Produced a comprehensive case study, presentation, and/or poster offering multiple perspectives on Interprofessional teams with other health professional students (Physician Assistant, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Nursing)

Identified and applied integrative health opportunities to enhance client wellness based in at least two of the three categories of social determinants of health: physical environment, social environment and individual characteristics/behaviors.
Participation in at least two semesters of interprofessional education activities

0061649e-0c14-41b5-9e35-94d28c2c9a27.description: Earners of the Structured Literacy Practicum badge concluded a 24 week comprehensive reading intervention for a student with characteristics of dyslexia. Earners completed a case study write up on their learner that included pre and post assessment data, recommendations for continued growth, and a reflection on teaching and learning. Completion of this badge completes the Structured Literacy/Dyslexia Interventionist microcredential.
0061649e-0c14-41b5-9e35-94d28c2c9a27.name: Structured Literacy Practicum

alignments.name: IDA Standard 3
alignments.description: IDA Standard 3: Assessment: Demonstrate knowledge and skill with multiple measures of literacy assessment for diagnostic and instructional purposes.

alignments.name: IDA Standard 4
alignments.description: IDA Standard 4: Structured Literacy Instruction: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of literacy acquisition and provide effective instruction for learners with dyslexia.

alignments.name: IDA Standard 5
alignments.description: IDA Standard 5: Professional Dispositions and Practices: Demonstrate skills and disposition for effectively working with learners with reading difficulty.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners concluded a 24 week comprehension reading intervention for a student with characteristics of dyslexia. Earners were observed three times by a qualified Dyslexia Interventionist practicum supervisor and provided feedback on their lesson planning and instruction. A full case study write up on the student was also completed by the participant.

Earners learned and applied methods of assessment for students with characteristics of dyslexia. Earners analyzed pre and post assessment data and used these data to guide structured literacy lesson planning and reflect on responsiveness to instruction.

ce5a9b5d-0240-4f09-a44b-b67c78e96088.description: Participants in Carroll University's Institute on the Teaching of Reading have been equipped with the knowledge and skills to effectively integrate structured literacy practices into a new or existing literacy framework. Participants have obtained a deeper knowledge of scientifically based reading practices.
ce5a9b5d-0240-4f09-a44b-b67c78e96088.name: Structured Literacy

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have participated in three days of large and small group sessions, tailored to individual grade levels, instructional roles, and needs. Sessions include orthographic mapping, phonemic awareness, frameworks for small and whole group learning, understanding text levels, intervention practices, and comprehension instruction.

24f40e78-76c2-40bb-99f6-1632106e6aee.description: Learner has demonstrated applied data analysis skills through the completion of professional-level projects utilizing Microsoft Excel. With large, real-world data sets, they investigated business problems and made data-driven recommendations to inform key decisions. Technical skills mastered: data visualization, pivot tables, VLOOKUP, A/B Testing & Linear Regression. Professional skills mastered: communicating with data, hypothesis testing, understanding business metrics, & presenting findings.
24f40e78-76c2-40bb-99f6-1632106e6aee.name: Introduction to Applied Data Analytics-Excel Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have obtained the Excel Specialist Certification
Earners have scored a B- or higher in the "Intro to Applied Data Analytics" course.

00a8ea30-bbbb-4555-9839-2ff9b1b18d1f.description: Learner demonstrated business intelligence data visualization skills through completion of professional-level projects utilizing Tableau Software. With large, real-world data sets, they investigated problems and created intuitive visualizations. Technical skills mastered: calculated fields, joining & blending data, creating interactive dashboards with sets & parameters. Professional skills mastered: communicating with data, visualization best-practices, data storytelling, digital presentation.
00a8ea30-bbbb-4555-9839-2ff9b1b18d1f.name: Data Visualization with Tableau - Tableau Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have obtained the Tableau Specialist Certification.
Earners have scored a B- or higher in the course "Data Visualization."

aa9fcfd6-1522-48cb-ab18-cb8841fbda00.description: Earners demonstrate proficiency in thinking critically and creatively through work-place simulations in four core sub-competency areas: 1) gathering and assessing relevant information; 2) identifying patterns; 3) questioning assumptions; and 4) drawing well-reasoned conclusions. Earners can distinguish, recognize, and identify relevant information in order to draw conclusion and analyze information. Earners will also receive a detailed breakdown of strengths and weaknesses for each module.
aa9fcfd6-1522-48cb-ab18-cb8841fbda00.name: Critical Thinking for the 21st Century

badge_template_activities.title: Students will complete the module "Gather and Assess Relevant Information" with a minimum score of 85%. This module works with students to: distinguish facts from opinions; recognize the role of purpose and bias in a position; identify core issues; provide thoughtful analysis; identify trustworthy sources; and use evidence to support a recommendation.

Students will complete the module "Identify Patterns" with a minimum score of 85%. This module works with students to: make sense of seemingly unrelated data sets with multiple variables; recognize trends in the context of their learning; perform thorough and thoughtful research; utilize visual aids; reflect on the meaning of the patterns.

Students will complete the module "Question Assumptions" with a minimum score of 85%. This module works with students to: identify assumptions embedded in statements; explain approach for determining if assumptions are true; pull out underlying assumptions from statements; and identify unstated assumptions.

Students will complete the module "draw conclusions" with a minimum score of 85%. This module works with students to: make connections from multiple sources of information; use evidence to support a conclusion and make a recommendation; identify key details and issues; and analyze information in light of key considerations.

b08c73c4-6ff8-4fb4-82dd-2873d621ec7e.description: This workshop presents backwards design and universal design for learning as intentional approaches to developing inclusive learning experiences that guide all students toward achieving meaningful outcomes and gaining relevant competencies.
b08c73c4-6ff8-4fb4-82dd-2873d621ec7e.name: Designing Inclusive Courses

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a live workshop session and complete relevant activities designed to achieve the following learning outcomes: -Design a course that ensures all students can demonstrate evidence of learning that aligns with course outcomes. -Support all students in meeting those learning outcomes through responsive and scaffolded learning experiences.

Implement the equity-minded backward course design we've covered during this workshop by creating a course outline or design matrix that documents working through the stages of the process for the participant's own course. Upload a Word or PDF file of your course outline or design matrix - along with a syllabus or any other documentation about the evidence of learning and assessments planned for the course.

e4222620-1489-452f-9898-f693b7821049.description: Completing this course indicates that this individual can: Define the differences in active and passive technology use, and identify the appropriate times for both technology uses; Identify and explain five key reasons that technology should be utilized in a learning environment; Point to a framework for evaluating any type of instructional technology use in any learning environment; Utilize the SAMR framework to understand how technology is utilized to learn to use technology.
e4222620-1489-452f-9898-f693b7821049.name: Modify: Understanding Tech Use in the Classroom

alignments.name: ISTE Educator Standard
alignments.description: ISTE Educator Standard 2.1 Learner a, b, c; ISTE Educator Standard 2.2 Leader a, b; ISTE Educator Standard 2.4 c

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in a self-paced, asynchronous course designed to reflect a wide variety of perspectives on technology integration to support learning. The learner is required to share reflections on these ideas in the course community discussion boards and digital feedback tools as they go through the course. This allows them to explore the ideas of even more key stakeholders as they encounter the reflections of others in the course community.

5b6efdb1-1937-4e85-9dfe-4d15b48c982b.description: Participants in the Precepting Nursing Students have completed six online modules designed to enhance their knowledge and improve their practice as nursing preceptors.
5b6efdb1-1937-4e85-9dfe-4d15b48c982b.name: Precepting Nursing Students

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have completed the six-module course and completed the Nursing Preceptor Credential Quiz. The six modules include: 1) Role of the Preceptor; 2) Expectations and Orientation; 3) Get to Know the Student; 4) Mentoring as a Preceptor; 5) Clinical Judgement for Preceptors; and 6) Evaluative Supervision.

9ebcf2e5-e974-4dbc-895f-8ad462e65d75.description: This credential explores using simulation to educate nurses in both an academic and in a clinical setting. Participants will learn the theory and standards of simulation. Participants will: understand the theory utilized with simulation education in nursing; apply theoretical concepts to the development, implementation, and evaluation of simulated experiences, and construct pre-briefing and debriefing sessions that incorporate evidence-based techniques.
9ebcf2e5-e974-4dbc-895f-8ad462e65d75.name: Simulation Use for Educating Nurses

badge_template_activities.title: Participants developed a simulation scenario, applying theoretical concepts and current practice standards. Participants constructed pre-briefing and debriefing sessions that incorporated theory driven methods, and demonstrated an understanding of theory and current standards of simulation

8b1de796-5dfb-4f5d-9410-45d47a037198.description: This two-day experience, facilitated by the Office of Violence Prevention, engages participants in both preventative and response measures for professionals to recognize how violence manifests within educational spaces. 6 hours of training in prevention theory, bystander intervention tactics, and action planning will prepare future educators to change cultures in their classrooms to be based in respect and empathy, rather than power and control.
8b1de796-5dfb-4f5d-9410-45d47a037198.name: Violence Prevention

alignments.name: Wisconsin Social and Emotional Learning Vision
alignments.description: The Wisconsin Social and Emotional Learning Vision states that, ‘children and adults acquire and effectively apply the knowledge, attitudes, and skills necessary to understand and manage emotions, set and achieve positive goals, feel and show empathy for others, establish and maintain positive relationships, and make responsible decisions.’

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have participated in a two-day training facilitated by the Office of Violence prevention. Participants have practiced intervention skills to empower gender equity in the classroom, and refined prevention-based or response-based actions. They have investigated case studies in gender-based violence in educational spaces. They have worked through the spectrum of violence to prepare and practice pro-social interventions in the classroom.

0d0961e6-2c4c-4140-8113-a08a4066df79.description: Best Practices in Transformational Community-Centered Public Safety is designed for police/public safety officers and community leaders to examine and implement a holistic approach to the CCPS framework within their own communities. Recipients have examined current practices and challenges within their own communities and built a network of partners to collaborate on public safety initiatives as they explore the CCPS model.
0d0961e6-2c4c-4140-8113-a08a4066df79.name: Best Practices in Transformational Community-Centered Public Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients of this badge have completed the CCPS Action Plan, which serves as a collective reflection of learning and a plan for implementing short-term goals for the work in their community as it begins implementing CCPS. Recipients have identified the potential barriers, and required resources to their intended actionable tasks. Participants have identified community assets.

Recipients of this badge have participated in the synchronous portion of the workshop, in order to build relationships and build community as they embark on the implementation of the CCPS framework. In this setting, they have engaged in problem-solving exercises and case studies as they evaluate and share best practices for (re)building trust in public safety, cultivating engagement and community partnerships.

6cdac1e7-da82-4084-8242-9a59325c9857.description: This workshop offers strategies for creating an inclusive climate in your classes by promoting relationships with and among students that prioritize the dignity, belonging, and respect necessary for learning.
6cdac1e7-da82-4084-8242-9a59325c9857.name: Building Community for All Learners

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a live workshop session and complete relevant activities designed to achieve the following learning outcomes: - Implement strategies for engaging students with diverse needs and goals to support their learning and improve their success. - Cultivate a culture of dignity so all students are valued and gain a sense of belonging as part of a learning community.

Implement of the lessons of the workshop in one of two ways: Option 1: Submit a revised copy of your syllabus indicating where you have changed content, policies, and language to communicate your commitment to inclusion towards all students. Option 2: Document how you plan to implement strategies for inclusion beyond the message communicated by your syllabus. Upload a Word or PDF file of your syllabus or inclusion plan as proof of completion.

9f25cd3b-beec-4ab8-b295-84a5a79f2462.description: This workshop covers how to design assessments that are transparent, inclusive, and accessible in order to fairly and equitably evaluate student learning and the achievement of course outcomes.
9f25cd3b-beec-4ab8-b295-84a5a79f2462.name: Crafting Equitable Assessments

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a live workshop session and complete relevant activities designed to achieve the following learning outcomes: Craft both formative and summative assessments that invite all students to demonstrate their learning and achievement of outcomes. Evaluate student learning using equitable and transparent methods that mitigate for institutionalized forms of racism, ableism, sexism, and classism.

Implement the feedback and revision plans you worked on during the workshop by fully revising at least one assessment from a current course following the TiLT framework for transparency and UDL principles for inclusive assessment. Upload a Word or PDF file of your revised assessment and grading criteria to this assessment as proof of completion.

0296eb46-100d-4291-ba43-3d1809423583.description: Healthcare organizations are committed to improving the quality of clinical care, increasing patient engagement, caring for diverse populations, and reducing costs. A critical component of these initiatives is analyzing data to support strategic decision making. In this course, participants will learn data cleaning, visualization and analysis, and creation of dashboards. At the end of this course, participants will complete a healthcare data analytics project using Microsoft Excel 365.
0296eb46-100d-4291-ba43-3d1809423583.name: Healthcare Data Analytics Using Microsoft Excel

badge_template_activities.title: At the completion of this course, learners will demonstrate preparation and cleaning of data, completion of descriptive analysis, and creation of dashboards using Microsoft Excel 365 using a provided healthcare data analytics project.

b3894c10-d015-4bfe-9c5b-13be87e77709.description: The recipient of the Equity-Minded Instructor has completed the full professional development series addressing key elements of effective and inclusive teaching from course design and assessment to class climate.
b3894c10-d015-4bfe-9c5b-13be87e77709.name: The Equity Minded Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Designing Inclusive Courses
Crafting Equitable Assessments
Building Community for All Learners

06d0f70a-a17d-457f-9709-41fa26bf5887.description: Recipients of the Educator Inquiry Project badge have demonstrated understanding of the inquiry process as transformative practice. Participating educators engage in the inquiry process as professional learners to foster growth and curiosity focused on building inquiry-based, equitable practices in their own teaching. Additionally, they gain skills to actively participate in systemic change within their communities of practice.
06d0f70a-a17d-457f-9709-41fa26bf5887.name: Educator Inquiry Project

badge_template_activities.title: Badge recipients have designed and implemented their inquiry action research supported by completing the required coursework and engaging in the learning community. All recipients have presented their project during the final synchronous session.

Badge recipients have participated in two synchronous meetings with other participants and facilitators of the Educator Inquiry Project, and have participated in four accountability group meetings to engage with other learners and their projects.

005197d1-4616-4af4-a5f9-c285b9dbc74b.description: Participants who complete the Contact Investigator Training Badge demonstrate: 1. Knowledge of the basics of COVID-19, including transmission, signs and symptoms of the disease, and the incubation and infectious periods. 2. Ability to identify and apply COVID-19 contact investigation protocols to realistic scenarios. 3. Understanding of ethical implications surrounding contacting tracing and handling private health information. 4. Ability to apply social determinants of health tenants.
005197d1-4616-4af4-a5f9-c285b9dbc74b.name: COVID 19 Contact Investigation Training Badge (copy)

badge_template_activities.title: This two-day, interactive training, developed by the Waukesha Country Public Health Division and Carroll University consists of four modules that includes ASTHO Training, Wisconsin Electronic Disease Surveillance System (WEDSS) Training, contact investigation scenarios, and Microsoft Teams Training.
Participant received and uploaded earned certificate: ASTHOS Making Contact: A Training for COVID-19 Contact Tracers Certificate.

Participant completed and passed each of three module assessments with a minimum score of 4/5, demonstrating efficiency in the following areas: Wisconsin Electronic Disease Surveillance System (WEDSS) Training, contact investigation scenarios, and Microsoft Teams Training.

239cf719-d3b0-427c-86a8-0ddc239973bf.description: Participants who complete the curriculum will demonstrate: 1. Knowledge of the basics of COVID-19, including transmission, signs, and symptoms of the disease, and the incubation and infectious periods; 2. The ability to identify and apply disease investigation protocols to realistic scenarios; 3. Understanding of ethical implications surrounding contact tracing and handling private health information; and, 4. The ability to apply social determinants of health tenants to disease investigation.
239cf719-d3b0-427c-86a8-0ddc239973bf.name: Disease Investigation Training (copy)

badge_template_activities.title: This three-day, interactive training, developed by the Waukesha Country Public Health Division and Carroll University consists of seven modules leading to the Disease Investigation Badge inclusive of the following training: ASTHO Training, Wisconsin Electronic Disease Surveillance System (WEDSS) Training-CI, Contact Investigation Scenarios, Microsoft Teams Training, Disease Investigation, WEDSS Training--DI, and Disease Investigation Scenarios.

Participant completed and passed each of six module assessments with a minimum score of 4/5, demonstrating efficiency in the following areas: Wisconsin Electronic Disease Surveillance System (WEDSS) Training,-CI Contact Investigation Scenarios, Microsoft Teams Training, Disease Investigation, WEDSS Training--DI, and Disease Investigation Scenarios.
Participant received and uploaded earned certificate: ASTHOS Making Contact: A Training for COVID-19 Contact Tracers Certificate.

072d5a65-6fd0-4215-9c9d-a2a2acab8d77.description: This self-paced course provides individuals with three key skills in data analytics using Microsoft Excel: data understanding and preparation, visualization and analysis, and result communication via dashboards and storytelling. These skills are useful for improving the quality of clinical care supporting decision-making in various healthcare organizations. Full access to Microsoft Excel 365 version is preferred. The Microsoft Excel app and web version are not recommended.
072d5a65-6fd0-4215-9c9d-a2a2acab8d77.name: Healthcare Data Analytics Using Microsoft Excel

badge_template_activities.title: The learner will review the materials Microsoft Excel tutorials provided via the Canvas site. An analysis project will be completed in Microsoft Excel demonstrating the following competencies given a healthcare scenario and data set: Data wrangling (prep, cleaning, and transformation) and dashboard creation and storytelling. The documents to be submitted includes a completed data dictionary, updated dataset and results, and Excel spreadsheet(s) with visualizations, analytics, and dashboard(s).
